Text: It’s been a long day- smelling smoke at 3am,seeing the fire on the horizon,evacuation at 5am,then seeing coverage on the national news.We are so lucky here in Laguna Beach because of the incredible heroism and hardwork of our Firefighters! -harley @OCFireAuthority @lagunafirepfa https://t.co/Vc0pH43iUh

I am thrilled to announce that I will be joining the @envirovoters Ed Fund Board of Directors! #Climate action is more critical than ever and this org is leading the way for our state. I look forward to our partnership. 

Read more: https://t.co/m2uVLpbBbm https://t.co/euxuov6a3f

On the anniversary of the #Jan6th insurrection, it’s abundantly clear we can never take our democracy for granted.

With Join Together for America, we will elect leaders who will fight for its survival & always put our country above their self interest. https://t.co/xMHMdu3WAG

While it has been the great honor of my life to serve Orange County's Coastal congressional district, I am officially suspending my campaign for Congress.

As of now, the new Orange County Coast seat is 66% of the district I represented in Congress and have been running in since 2017.

I am prepared to flip this seat again, and we will defeat right-wing radical @MichelleSteelCA in 2022.

It's clear it should stay that way. https://t.co/6N0Ew08Zph

Today, we are at a crisis point. 

This Mississippi case could unravel the constitutional right to an abortion. Everyone deserves the freedom to make their own decisions about their bodies & their lives.

.@MichelleSteelCA just said her votes against the Violence Against Women Act and the Bipartisan Background Checks Act were "the right thing for Orange County."

Let’s make it perfectly clear: OC families deserve an end to domestic and gun violence.

Addressing climate change must be our top priority. https://t.co/UH71qS5ctm

.@MichelleSteelCA has joined the state of Mississippi in asking #SCOTUS to overturn Roe v. Wade. Should that happen, nearly half of women of reproductive age could lose access to safe abortions overnight. 

Government must not threaten a woman's constitutional right to choose.

Orange County families are being taxed twice on the same dollar, and @MichelleSteelCA's solution is to vote against the increase in the SALT Cap by 700% in the Build Back Better Act. It’s clear that she's only out for herself and her wealthy donors.

Happy Thanksgiving! I am thankful to to spend this day with friends and family and, honestly, to leave politics at the door during our Thanksgiving meal. 

Today is about celebrating each other and our time together, no matter where we stand on political issues. https://t.co/TDYuCEliKH

In case you missed it, the CDC expanded COVID-19 booster shot eligibility to all adults 6 months after their last dose! Go get your booster this holiday season so we can keep our loved ones safe. https://t.co/na8Inl2HOZ
With 2022 fast approaching, it is important that we stay focused and organized. Thank you @DemOC_PAC, @GenBluePF, and South Bay Cares for having me last week! https://t.co/o1DRNAQKIz
RT @AlyssaNapuri: It’s been four hours and @MichelleSteelCA has said NOTHING about the second oil spill to happen in her district this year…

.@MichelleSteelCA should immediately return the campaign donations she accepted from the firm responsible for this crisis, and back the commonsense and bipartisan offshore oil drilling ban.

7/7

.@MichelleSteelCA is thoroughly corrupt. We are seeing the consequences for her blind obedience to her Big Oil overlords in today’s spill.

6/7

.@MichelleSteelCA has refused to call for a ban on offshore drilling - despite protests, and even after the press revealed that she had accepted donations from the oil firm responsible. 

5/7

Orange County deserves responsible, reliable leadership in Washington that answers to us - not to Big Oil and its lobbyists.

4/7

We need to ban new offshore oil drilling, and immediately start the permanent transition to renewable energy sources. We need to save our coastal communities for ourselves, our small businesses, and for our children. 

3/7

But we will never get there as long as Big Oil - and its bought-and-paid-for cronies like @MichelleSteelCA - are in Washington. 

2/7

Here we go again. I have said this time and time again, but Orange County’s coasts - and the tens of thousands of jobs that rely on safe, clean beaches - will never be secure as long as offshore drilling continues. 

1/7
Despite all this talk about lowering taxes for OC families, @MichelleSteelCA just voted against the Build Back Better Act… which lowers taxes for OC families.

Friendly reminder: Michelle Steel supports the Trump Tax Scam that raised taxes on middle class families, and would add $1.7T to our deficit. 

If you really cared about the nation’s debt, Michelle, resubmit my bill that would combat it firsthand. https://t.co/0pdCRjUa88

.@POTUS signed the bipartisan infrastructure bill into law. Our state will get much-needed funding with:
- $29.5B for roads & bridges
- $9.45B for public transit
- $384M for EV chargers
- $3.5B for clean water projects
+ more including wildfire protection!

Happy Veterans Day! 🇺🇸  Thank you to everyone who has served our country — they are some of the most remarkable people you'll ever meet.

Our veterans do so much for all of us. We need to make sure we do the same and fight for policies that will support them. https://t.co/YZciQ5L5O6
Until that time, we will continue holding Congresswoman @MichelleSteelCA to account for her repeated failure to put Orange County families' needs ahead of her own political self interest.

We have full faith that the California Citizens' Redistricting Commission will execute fair district boundaries, and this seat will remain the most competitive race in the nation once the final maps are approved. https://t.co/ayupaBwPpe
Our district's infrastructure will benefit from the bipartisan infrastructure framework, full stop.

It's a fact: by voting no on the bipartisan infrastructure bill, @MichelleSteelCA voted against improving our state's:
👉 ports
👉 roads
👉 broadband
👉 water infrastructure

Let's be clear — abortion is healthcare. Yet, @MichelleSteelCA wants to strip women's healthcare rights and overturn Roe v. Wade. 

Government must stay out of health decisions that are between women and their doctors.

When it comes to the supply chain crisis, the last thing we need is more government regulations. If @MichelleSteelCA actually wanted to fix the problem, she should have voted for the bipartisan infrastructure bill.

It's common sense: OC will benefit from the bold investments in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill. Yet, @MichelleSteelCA voted AGAINST it.

OC deserves a leader who will fight for our communities.
A vast majority of voters across parties agree: it's time to end offshore drilling.

Necessary investments in our nation's infrastructure are long overdue. It's time for Democrats and Republicans to work together and pass the Bipartisan Infrastructure Framework & the #BuildBackBetter bills.
We must address our aging infrastructure and energy sources immediately. That's why I support ending offshore drilling and making key investments in clean, renewable energy. https://t.co/tk22gbjCM8
